resources.string: PUZZLES! Click Open Zoom Meetings on the dialog shown by your browser. If you don`t see a dialog, click Launch Zoom below.
BONUS! Click Open Zoom Meetings on the dialog shown by your browser. If you don`t see a dialog, click Launch Zoom below.
ADMIN! Click Open Zoom Meetings on the dialog shown by your browser.
Chess is a game for people of all ages.

Playing chess from childhood contributes to the improvement of academic performance and the harmonious development of the individual. They develop memory, logical thinking, improve concentration, teach to analyze and systematize large amounts of information; encourage creativity, ingenuity and the development of imagination, bring up willpower and the desire to achieve the goal.
Statement about the chess of world champions.
Wilhelm Steinitz (1836-1900), World Chess Champion 1886-1894, Austria-Hungary, USA
Emanuel Lasker (1868–1941), World Chess Champion 1894–1921, German Empire
“Without mistakes, there can be no brilliant victories”
Hello,\n you are welcomed by the app "chess places GO"

The app will show you all the chess places in Munich and its surroundings (clubs, cafes, outdoor places). The app will help you find a chess club that suits your level of play. You can also enjoy solving chess problems from the best games of Munich chess players! Visit chess places and unlock the bonus!

The best chess books
1. "Bobby Fischer teaches you how to play chess" - Robert Fischer
2. "Chess game textbook" - Emanuel Lasker
3. "My system" - Aron Nimzowitsch
4. "Endgame Tutorial" - Mark Dvoretsky
5. "My great predecessors" - Garry Kasparov

Grandmaster`s advice
1. In the opening, a chess player must develop all the pieces, fight for the center, castling
2. In the middlegame, a chess player must make a plan (3-4 moves ahead) and follow it.
Best plan: active play (pawn advances, regrouping of pieces and exchanges)
3. In the endgame, the strength of the king increases

The best chess platforms on the Internet 
https://lichess.org/
https://www.chess.com/
